lead_paragraph: The Cortlandt Street subway station, destroyed on Sept. 11 and scheduled to reopen in 2018, will include texts from historical documents on the walls, similar to a crossword puzzle.

headline.print_headline: Art Woven From Words for New Subway Station
headline.main: At Cortlandt Street Subway Station, Art Woven From Words

snippet: The Cortlandt Street subway station, destroyed on Sept. 11 and scheduled to reopen in 2018, will include texts from historical documents on the walls, similar to a crossword puzzle.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority board approves $1 million art project by Ann Hamilton to be featured at Cortlandt Street subway station; stop was destroyed in Sept 11th attacks and is slated to reopen in 2018 where it will be gateway to new World Trade Center and National Sept 11 Memorial Museum; project will fill station's walls with horizontal and vertical text fragments.
